alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 5:56PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SAN JUAN COUNTY THROUGH 630 PM MDT... At 555 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Burnham, or 19 miles south of Shiprock, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Kirtland, Shiprock, Fruitland, Upper Fruitland, Nenahnezad and Ojo Amarillo. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 21 and 38, near Mile Marker 41, and between Mile Markers 43 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
